text: A song of ascents.\f + \fr Ps 120 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
In my distress I called to Yahweh,
“Deliver my life, O Yahweh, from lying lips,
What shall be given to you,\f + \fr 120:3 \ft That is, by God against the false accuser \f*
and what more shall be done to you,
\add The\add* sharpened arrows of a warrior,
with burning charcoals from broom trees.
Woe to me, that I sojourn in Meshech,
\add that\add* I dwell among the tents of Kedar.
Too long my soul has had its dwelling
I \add am for\add* peace, but when I speak,
